newsitem.title: UK: NWE straight-run fuel oil quiet, Med more active.
newsitem.headline: NWE straight-run fuel oil quiet, Med more active.

text.p: NWE straight-run fuel oil markets were quiet on Tuesday as traders dragged themselves back to their desks after Easter.
One prominent low sulphur seller said his phone had hardly rung. Prices were static, despite the fall in crude values, because there was little solid moving them, he added.
But another seller said interest existed for better quality grades, with vessel shortages blocking deals.
"There are a few interested parties for loading mid-April. It is more a question of people trying to line up vessels at reasonable rates," said the seller.
The Mediterranean straight-run markets were more lively. A Tunisian tender, for loading 6-8/4, was awarded on Friday to a Swiss-based independent trader, players said.
A long-term Tunisian and spot Tunisian and Egyptian tenders, for late month loading, were due to be awarded on Wednesday.
One 0.3 percent low sulphur Libyan cargo which loaded two weekends ago was heard to have gone to the Far East. A second was heard sold to an Italian trader.
Traders said there was good availability of Russian high sulphur straight-run cargoes from the Black Sea.
